H0.text: Control is the term for the participants who received a sugar pill, the half of the participants in the drug company’s study testing a pill to reduce cases of stomach virus.

H1.text: Experimental participants are the half of the participants who received a sugar pill in the drug company’s trial to reduce cases of stomach virus.

H2.text: The dependent variable is the half of the participants who received a sugar pill in the drug company's study testing a new medicine to reduce cases of stomach virus.

H3.text: Independent variable is the participants who received the sugar pill in the drug company’s study that tested a pill to reduce cases of stomach virus, with half of the participants given the active medication and the other half given a sugar pill.

A4.text: In placebo-controlled trials, the control group receives a placebo such as a sugar pill, while the experimental group receives the active treatment.

A5.text: The experimental group in clinical trials typically receives the active treatment, not the placebo.
